name: House of Vampires Quiz | Horror Mixture | 10 Questions

questions.text: What director played a vampire hunter in "The Fearless Vampire Killers"?
questions.explanation:
Roman Polanski.

	Count Von Krolock, a vampire, kidnapped Sarah (Sharon Tate) after Prof. Abronsius and his assistant Alfred (Roman Polanski) came to the village to find out who the vampire was and kill it.  Rajmund Roman Thierry Polanski (Born 18 Aug 1933) was a French-Polish film director, producer, writer, and actor, married a few times, including to his co-star Sharon Tate, his second wife, in 1968.  She was murdered by the Manson family in 1969.  He's directed "Chinatown", "Rosemary's Baby", "The Pianist", and "What?"

questions.text: What performer from "...And Justice For All" played a vampire in "Saturday the 14th"?
questions.explanation:
Jeffrey Tambor.

	Waldemar, a vampire (Jeffrey Tambor) and his wife, Yolanda, tried to get a magic book from a house inherited by John (Richard Benjamin) and Mary (Paula Prentiss), but Van Helsing (Severn Darden) also wanted the book.  One of the kids opened the magic book and various monsters popped up in the house at various times throughout the rest of the movie. Jeffrey Tambor played lawyer Jay Porter in the movie "...And Justice For All" and has appeared in "Mr. Mom", "Life Stinks", "Muppets From Space", and many TV shows, including "The Ropers", "Three's Company", "The Larry Sanders Show", "Mr. Sunshine",  "Arrested Development", and "Transparent".

questions.text: What performer from "Enter the Dragon" met a vampire from another planet in "Queen of Blood"?
questions.explanation:
John Saxon.

	"Queen of Blood" (1966) involved an astronaut (John Saxon) and his crew sent to pick up people who were stranded on Mars.  When they arrived, the only survivor was a woman which they later found out was a vampire.  On the way back to Earth, she began killing men on the ship.  However, a woman on the crew fought back and scratched the vampire woman, who bled to death. John Saxon (born Carmine Orrico, Aug 5, 1935) has appeared on television and movies over the years, including "Enter the Dragon" (as Roper, one of the contestants in the fighting competition), "Battle Beyond the Stars", "A Nightmare on Elm Street", and "My Mom's a Werewolf".

questions.text: What performer from "Petticoat Junction" met a vampire in "Blood Bath"?
questions.explanation:
Lori (aka Linda) Saunders.

	"Blood Bath" was originally a European movie about a shy sculptor, but then scenes were added in which he killed some of the young women he sculpted.  Later, scenes were added which revealed that he was a spy assigned to capture or kill some of these people.  Still later, scenes were added which showed him biting people and drinking blood.  He was a sculptor vampire spy.  Linda Saunders played a woman he loved. When set to star on "Petticoat Junction", Linda Saunders (born Linda Marie Hines Oct 4, 1941) changed her name to Lori Saunders so she wouldn't be confused with Linda Kaye Henning, who had already been a regular on the show for years.  She played Bobbie Jo Bradley in "Petticoat Junction" and was a regular on the last season of "The Beverly Hillbillies" and a regular on the TV show "Dusty's Trail" with Bob Denver.

questions.text: What performer from "Wildcats" fought vampires in "Blade"?
questions.explanation:
Wesley Snipes.

	Blade (Wesley Snipes) fought and killed vampires in various movies.  His mother had been bitten by a vampire when she was pregnant with Blade, so Blade had the strength of a vampire but could walk around in the daytime.  The vampires were always plotting to get rid of him so they could take over the world. Wesley Snipes has appeared in various movies, including "Wildcats" (as football player Trumaine), "Passenger 57", "White Men Can't Jump", and "Money Train".

questions.text: What performer from the movie "The Beverly Hillbillies" met vampires in "Bordello of Blood" (1996)?
questions.explanation:
Erika Eleniak.

	Comedian Dennis Miller, as Rafe Guttman, popped up in the "Tales From the Crypt" movie "Bordello of Blood" in which he helped Katherine Verdoux (Erika Eleniak) find her missing brother (Corey Feldman), not realizing that he had been turned into a vampire by a vampire prostitute. Erika Eleniak played a lifeguard in the first season of "Baywatch". She later appeared as a stripper on a ship full of terrorists on "Under Siege" and as Elly May Clampett in the big screen movie "The Beverly Hillbillies".

questions.text: What performer from "Child's Play" played a vampire in "Fright Night"?
questions.explanation:
Chris Sarandon.

	In "Fright Night" Chris Sarandon played the lead vampire, Jerry Dandridge, who moved next door to Charlie Brewster, a teenager who liked to watch vampire movies.  Of course, nobody believed Charlie when he told people that he saw his vampire neighbor through the window biting a woman whose dead body turned up a few days later. Chris Sarandon played another character who had problems with someone named Charles in "Child's Play" in which he (Detective Mike Norris) fought off a doll inhabited by the soul of killer Charles Lee Ray.  Chris also appeared in the movies "Lipstick", "Dog Day Afternoon", and the TV movie "The Day Christ Died", playing Jesus.

questions.text: What performer from "Cape Fear" fought vampires in "From Dusk Till Dawn"?
questions.explanation:
Juliette Lewis.

	Criminals held a family hostage in their RV so they could get to Mexico to meet some criminals at a bar.  While they waited, the sun went down, and the strippers attacked everyone, because they were vampires. Juliette Lewis played the teenage girl in "From Dusk Till Dawn" (Katherine Fuller), "Cape Fear" (Danielle Bowden), and "National Lampoon's Christmas Vacation" (Audrey Griswold).  She appeared on the TV series "I Married Dora" and continues to make appearances on TV shows, including "Secrets and Lies" as Detective Andrea Cornell.

George Romero.

	Martin was a teenager who claimed he was really an old man who just remained young because he was a vampire, or was it all a fantasy?  He lived with his old uncle, who told him that if Martin acted like a vampire or killed anyone, he would drive a stake through Martin's heart. George Romero is most famous for directing zombie movies, including "Night of the Living Dead" and "Dawn of the Dead".  He's also directed other movies, including "Knightriders", "Creepshow", and "Monkey Shines".

questions.text: Who played the lead vampire woman in "Vamp" (1986)?
questions.explanation:
Grace Jones.

	In the movie "Vamp", A.J. visited Queen Katrina (Grace Jones) to hire her to strip at a party, but she killed him with a bite, because she was a vampire.  His friend tried to find out what happened, but got attacked by various vampires and violent people all night. Grace Jones was a singer ("Demolition Man") and an actress ("A View to a Kill" and "Conan the Destroyer").
